job description:
Innovative Solutions. World Class Support.

Headquartered in Somerset, NJ, SHI International Corp. has transformed itself from a $1 million “software-only” regional reseller into a $8.5 billion+ global provider of technology products and services. Privately-held and under the guidance of its current ownership since 1989, SHI has experienced tremendous growth in size and scope. Its organic growth and over two decades of stability are a direct result of backing a highly-skilled, tenured sales force with software volume licensing experts, hardware procurement specialists and certified IT services professionals.

SHI offers custom IT solutions for every aspect of your environment from software and hardware procurement to deployment planning, configuration, data center optimization, mobility and IT asset management.
SHI supports their clients from over 30 offices throughout the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Germany, France and Hong Kong. SHI’s goal is to foster long-term, mutually-beneficial relationships with its customers and partners, every day.

What SHI Can Offer:
  • World Class Facility includes on site gyms, restaurants and community events
  • Ongoing opportunities for personal and professional growth and development due to our strong promote from within philosophy
  • Work in an up-beat, creative, and fun environment
  • Benefits, include medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending
  • Supportive Management and Leadership
Passionate about using data science to create better customer experiences, identifying potential sales opportunities and creating recommendations for high value sales motions with a high probability of success. The role requires both, in depth and hands on knowledge of existing advanced analytics practices and approaches including Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence and the creativity to discuss innovation opportunities with business partners and shape cutting edge applications and proposals. The Principal scientist needs to be comfortable to work in a multidisciplinary environment to drive business solutions.

The responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Directly participate in the delivery of data-driven research projects that have a direct impact on business results or product design for SHI
  • Will be the analytical lead and actively contribute to highly visible, complex projects, programs or solutions that are critical to SHI
  • Explore the space of analytical opportunities for a given problem and execute with a sound analytical strategy
  • Work effectively as part of a team and collaborate across business and functional groups to share results and leverage the work of project members to meet checkpoints and accomplish team objectives on time.
  • Acquire, augment, analyze and act on complex, high-dimensional data sets using high performance computing and advanced algorithms as required.
  • Manage relationships with partners across the various functions of SHI
  • A minimum of 5 years of combined industry/postdoctoral experience is required
  • Familiarity with large datasets, handling of sales datasets and understanding of data analysis workflows is required
  • Strong working knowledge of data mining algorithms including supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques including random forest, clustering, neural networks & deep learning is required
  • Proficient with one or more programming language such as C#
  • Familiarity with cloud computing
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, verbal, and written skills
Preferred Skills:
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing or text analytics methods
  • Experience with SQLServer
  • Provide service integration techniques for data visualization
